        (a) Wen, Y. H.; Cheng, J. K.; Feng, Y. L.; Zhang, J.; Li, Z. J.; Yao, Y. G. Inorg. Chim. Acta2005 358 3347
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        11a
        Hydrothermal syntheses, crystal structures and characterizations of three new copper coordination polymers
        Wen, Yi-Hang; Cheng, Jian-Kai; Feng, Yun-Long; Zhang, Jian; Li, Zhao-Ji; Yao, Yuan-Gen
        Inorganica Chimica Acta (2005), 358 (12), 3347-3354CODEN: ICHAA3; ISSN:0020-1693. (Elsevier B.V.)
        Three new copper complexes, [CuIICuI(L)(LH)(4,4'-bipy)3/2]n (1), [Cu(L)(4,4'-bipy)]n·3nH2O (2), and [Cu(LH)2(4,4'-bipy)]n (3), were hydrothermally synthesized by the reaction of Cu(NO3)2·3H2O with isophthalic acid (LH2) and 4,4'-bipyridine (4,4'-bipy) under different reaction conditions. Complex 1, a mixed-valence copper(I,II) complex, exhibits a 2-dimensional interpenetrating grid framework, in which five-coordinated CuII and three-coordinated CuI environments are established. The oxidn. states of center Cu atoms were confirmed by XPS and ESR spectra (EPR). Complex 2 features a 2-dimensional box-like bilayer architecture, in which CuII atoms are linked by isophthalate ligands to form a 1-dimensional double-chain and the resulting chains are further strutted by the 4,4'-bipy ligands. In complex 3, two bridging 4,4'-bipy ligands and two terminal LH- ligands confine the CuII center in a square planar coordination geometry. The whole mol. of 3 was arranged into a 1-dimensional linear chain structure. Addnl., the thermogravimetric analyses (TGA) for complexes 1-3 are also discussed.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXlvV2ksb8%253D&md5=0a409fc3e0ad6bf90f7f77acf9de2b27
        (b) Fang, R. Q.; Zhang, X. M. Inorg. Chem.2006 45 4801
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        11b
        Diversity of Coordination Architecture of Metal 4,5-Dicarboxyimidazole
        Fang, Rui-Qin; Zhang, Xian-Ming
        Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (12), 4801-4810CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Seven complexes of metal imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid (H3dcbi), namely, [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)3]·H2O (1·α), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2]·2H2O (1·β), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2]·2H2O (1·γ), [Cd(H2dcbi)2(H2O)2] (2), [Cd(Hdcbi)(H2O)] (3), [Cd5(Hdcbi)2(dcbi)2(H2O)]·xH2O (4), [Cd2(Hdcbi)(C2O4)] (5), [Ag5(Hdcbi)2(CN)] (6), and [Mn(Hdcbi)(H2O)] (7), were hydro(solvo)thermally synthesized by fine control over synthetic conditions such as stoichiometry, solvent, and pH value. X-ray single-crystal structural analyses reveal that they have rich structural chem. ranging from mononuclear (1), 1-dimensional (2), and two-dimensional (3 and 7) to three-dimensional (4-6), among which 1 crystallizes in three types (α, β, and γ) of polymorphs. Seven coordination modes of Hndcbi ranging from monodentate to μ5 were obsd., among which four modes are found 1st. The coordination geometries of the Cd(II) sites vary from five-coordinate trigonal bipyramid and square pyramid, six-coordinate octahedron to seven-coordinate pentagonal bipyramid. Analyses of the synthetic conditions and structures of the Cd(II) complexes show that the influences of the solvent and the metal-to-ligand molar ratio are very important to the products and coordination modes of Hndcbi (n = 0, 1, 2). Studies of the coordination modes of Hndcbi and the structures of the Cd(II) complexes also reveal that the singly deprotonated H2dcbi generally coordinates in the monodentate imidazole-N or N,O-chelate mode to result in mononuclear structures, the doubly deprotonated Hdcbi coordinates in the μ2, μ3, or μ4 mode to generate 1-dimensional or two-dimensional structures, and the triply deprotonated dcbi can coordinate in the μ5 mode to form three-dimensional structures. The cyanide was in situ formed via C-C bond cleavage of acetonitrile during the prepn. of 6, which adopts a rare μ4-kC,kC:kN,kN mode to bridge four Ag(I) ions. The microporous three-dimensional framework of 4 is maintained after the removal of the guest mols. Compds. 1-5 show strong violet emissions with maxima around 380 nm, tentatively attributed to the ligand-centered transition.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XksFWit7o%253D&md5=4ba277aa921d8181d3af572ec794f4a2
      12. 12
        (a) Wang, Y. L.; Yuan, D. Q.; Bi, W. H.; Li, X.; Li, X. J.; Li, F.; Cao, R. Cryst. Growth Des.2005 5 1849

        12a
        Syntheses and Characterizations of Two 3D Cobalt-Organic Frameworks from 2D Honeycomb Building Blocks
        Wang, Yu-Ling; Yuan, Da-Qiang; Bi, Wen-Hua; Li, Xing; Li, Xiao-Ju; Li, Feng; Cao, Rong
        Crystal Growth & Design (2005), 5 (5), 1849-1855CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        The hydrothermal reaction of Co(NO3)2·6H2O, imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid (H3IDC), and 4,4'-bipyridine (bipy) under different conditions affords two interesting metal-org. compds., {[Co3(IDC)2(4,4'-bipy)(H2O)4]·2H2O}n (1) and {[Co3(IDC)2(4,4'-bipy)3]·6H2O·DMF}n (2), both of which have been structurally characterized by single-crystal X-ray diffraction, elemental anal., IR spectroscopy, and thermogravimetric anal. Temp.-dependent magnetic susceptibility for 1 and 2 were also studied. The "all-chair" two-dimensional honeycomb networks, structurally analogous to CFx, were linked by the bridging 4,4'-bipy ligand in compd. 1 to give rise to a 2-fold interpenetrated 3D architecture. Compd. 2 features a three-dimensional open framework with hexagonal channels, generated from two-dimensional graphene-like layers pillared by 4,4'-bipy. The simplest cyclic motif of the 2D networks in 1 and 2 is a 24-membered hexagonal ring consisting of six Co(II) cations and six IDC3- trianions.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXltlyrsr4%253D&md5=417c6505e947d4e9aae5824fe66bd5b4
        (b) Chen, C. Y.; Cheng, P. Y.; Wu, H. H.; Lee, H. M. Inorg. Chem.2007 46 5691
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        12b
        Conformational Effect of 2,6-Bis(imidazol-1-yl)pyridine on the Self-Assembly of 1D Coordination Chains: Spontaneous Resolution, Supramolecular Isomerism, and Structural Transformation
        Chen, Chih-Yuan; Cheng, Pi-Yun; Wu, Hsin-Hsuan; Lee, Hon Man
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2007), 46 (14), 5691-5699CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        The achiral ligand 2,6-bis(imidazol-1-yl)pyridine (L) was used as the ditopic org. tecton for the formation of coordination polymers with Zn(II) ions. Hydrothermal reaction between L and ZnX2 (X = Br, Cl) afforded spontaneous resolved double helical motifs in ZnLCl2·0.5H2O (1) and ZnLBr2·0.25H2O (2). In the homochiral crystals of 1a and 2a, the helixes are of M-helicity, whereas, in 1b and 2b, they are of P-helicity. In contrast, solvothermal reaction between L and ZnCl2 in dried DMF afforded achiral ZnLCl2 (3a), which exhibits a zigzag polymeric motif. An achiral polymorph 3b which contains 21 helical chains was obtained in wet DMF. The formation of different 1-dimensional motifs was related to the conformations of L. All these compds. were characterized by IR spectroscopy, elemental analyses, and single-crystal x-ray diffraction. As revealed by TGA and powder x-ray diffraction study, the homochiral motif in 1 was stable even upon removal of guest water mols. Contrastingly, structural transformation from 3a or 3b to 1 is possible upon hydration.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXmsVaju78%253D&md5=8cb361ac315c7029a546de0ff77638f1

        17a
        Porous lanthanide-organic open frameworks with helical tubes constructed from interweaving triple-helical and double-helical chains
        Sun, Yan-Qiong; Zhang, Jie; Chen, Yong-Mei; Yang, Guo-Yu
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2005), 44 (36), 5814-5817CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Achiral channels as well as left- and right-handed helical tubes are present in novel lanthanide-org. frameworks, [Ln2(ImDC)2(H2O)3]·mH2O, prepd. under hydrothermal conditions from lanthanide oxides and 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid (H3ImDC), and characterized by x-ray diffraction. In the three-dimensional coordination polymers, the Ln atoms (Ln = Eu, Dy, Y, Pr, Nd, Sm, Gd, Tb, Er) are linked by 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid ligands with skew coordination orientation.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXhtVGlsLvF&md5=519628f7d04f00eeb0afaa32113e8d00
        (b) Zhang, M. B.; Chen, Y. M.; Zheng, S. T.; Yang, G. Y. Eur. J. Inorg. Chem.2006 1423
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        17b
        A 3D manganese coordination polymer [Mn3(IMDC)2(H2O)4] constructed from [Mn2(IMDC)2(H2O)2] layers and [Mn(H2O)2] pillars (IMDC = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylate)
        Zhang, Man-Bo; Chen, Yong-Mei; Zheng, Shou-Tian; Yang, Guo-Yu
        European Journal of Inorganic Chemistry (2006), (7), 1423-1428CODEN: EJICFO; ISSN:1434-1948. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        A novel three-dimensional coordination polymer [Mn3(IMDC)2(H2O)4] (1) (IMDC = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylate), consisting of [Mn2(IMDC)2(H2O)2] layers and [Mn(H2O)2] pillars, was synthesized hydrothermally and characterized by IR spectroscopy, elemental anal., TGA, and magnetic measurements. It is the 1st example of a 3-dimensional framework contg. 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylate in the family of Mn complexes. Variable-temp. magnetic susceptibility measurements show a weak antiferromagnetic coupling interaction between the MnII ions of the dimeric units.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28Xjsleitbs%253D&md5=34a41a28e47cfd2d429eb7609fb5030e
        (c) Sun, Y. Q.; Zhang, J.; Yang, G. Y. Chem. Commun.2006 4700
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        17c
        A series of luminescent lanthanide-cadmium-organic frameworks with helical channels and tubes
        Sun, Yan-Qiong; Zhang, Jie; Yang, Guo-Yu
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2006), (45), 4700-4702CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Lanthanide (Ln) oxides and cadmium (Cd) salts as sources of metals provided the first series of luminescent Ln-Cd-org. frameworks, [LnCd(imdc)(SO4)(H2O)3]·0.5H2O (Ln = Tb, Eu, Dy, Gd, Er, Yb, Y, Nd, Pr; H3imdc = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid), in which the Ln atoms are linked by imdc ligands with skew coordination orientation, resulting in novel hetero-metallic-org. frameworks with left-/right-handed helical tubes (L1/R1) and channels (L2/R2) along the b axis. The luminescence of the terbium, europium and dysprosium complexes is different from that of the gadolinium, erbium, ytterbium and yttrium complexes. The neodymium and praseodymium complexes show no NIR luminescence. Crystal structures were detd. for all nine complexes.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28Xht1Srt7vL&md5=43623295a62ee9b55e69f034d749f3d4
        (d) Sun, Y. Q.; Yang, G. Y. Dalton Trans.2007 3371
        Google Scholar
        There is no corresponding record for this reference.
      18. 18
        (a) Lu, W. G.; Su, C. Y.; Lu, T. B.; Jiang, L.; Chen, J. M. J. Am. Chem. Soc.2006 128 34
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        18a
        Two Stable 3D Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed by Nanoscale Cages via Sharing the Single-Layer Walls
        Lu, Wen-Guan; Su, Cheng-Yong; Lu, Tong-Bu; Jiang, Long; Chen, Jia-Mei
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2006), 128 (1), 34-35CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Two stable 3-dimensional metal-org. frameworks, {Na4[Cd7(IDC)6].3bpy.7H2O}n (bipy - 4,4'-bipyridine) and {(Bu4N)K3[Cd7(IDC)6].6H2O}n, are constructed by the hydrothermal reactions of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O and imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylate (IDC3-) using bpy and Bu4NBr as templates. Both structures show the same frameworks, which are composed by the nanoscale cages via sharing the single-layer walls.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXht12rtbvI&md5=7abe04dd1d0532bc6cf888691c66bfa8
        (b) Wang, X. L.; Qin, C.; Wang, E. B.; Xu, L. J. Mol. Struct.2005 749 45
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        18b
        New one-dimensional imidazole-bridged cadmium(II) coordination polymers - syntheses, crystal structures and photoluminescence
        Wang, Xinlong; Qin, Chao; Wang, Enbo; Xu, Lin
        Journal of Molecular Structure (2005), 749 (1-3), 45-50CODEN: JMOSB4; ISSN:0022-2860. (Elsevier B.V.)
        Two new d10 metal coordination polymers, [Cd(HIDC)(H2O)2]n (1) and [Cd(HIDC)(phen)]n (2) (H3IDC = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid, phen = 1,10-phenanthroline), were hydrothermally synthesized and characterized by elemental anal., IR, TG, and single crystal x-ray diffraction. X-ray single-crystal structural analyses reveal that 1 is a three-dimensional (3D) network featuring 1-dimensional honeycomb-like channels constructed from 1-dimensional coordination chains via hydrogen bonds, while the 3-dimensional supramol. framework of 2 is formed via π-π stacking interactions between chains. Also, both of them display photoluminescent properties in the blue range at room temp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXls1yns7o%253D&md5=c13306a4c65bedcf6a6a377cd90a06b8
        (c) Fang, R. Q.; Zhang, X. H.; Zhang, X. M. Cryst. Growth Des.2006 6 2637
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        18c
        A NaCl-like Metal-Organic Framework Constructed by Unprecedented Tetrahedral Cd4O6 and Cd5O6 Units
        Fang, Rui-Qing; Zhang, Xu-Hui; Zhang, Xian-Ming
        Crystal Growth & Design (2006), 6 (12), 2637-2639CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        A solvothermal reaction generated the NaCl-like metal-org. framework complex [Cd27(dcbi)16](SO4)3·22DMF (1, dcbi = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylate) which was characterized by x-ray crystallog. 1 Consists of a fcc. framework with three-dimensional intersecting channels contg. unprecedented tetrahedral Cd4O6 and Cd5O6 building units, and exhibits a strong violet blue photoluminescent emission.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XhtFOmtLrP&md5=805a19b7fd212d9d8ef77b32fe690c2e
        (d) Zhao, B.; Zhao, X. Q.; Shi, W.; Cheng, P. J. Mol. Struct.2007 830 143
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        18d
        Synthesis, structure and luminescent property of a 2D polymer containing silver ions
        Zhao, Bin; Zhao, Xiao-Qing; Shi, Wei; Cheng, Peng
        Journal of Molecular Structure (2007), 830 (1-3), 143-146CODEN: JMOSB4; ISSN:0022-2860. (Elsevier B.V.)
        A silver(I) complex with 4,5-dicarboxyimidazole (H3dcbi) has been synthesized by a hydrothermal method and proven to be a novel 2D coordination polymer [Ag(H2dcbi)]n which crystd. in the monoclinic crystal system with a space group of P2(1)/c. Each Ag(I) ion is coordinated to three O atoms and one N atom which completes the trigonal pyramidal geometry of the Ag(I) ion. The solid-state fluorescent emission spectra of the complex was investigated.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhsF2gtbo%253D&md5=087884c144f4477bf51547c4296d813c
        (e) Gu, J. Z.; Lu, W. G.; Jiang, L.; Zhou, H. C.; Lu, T. B. Inorg. Chem.2007 46 5835
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        18e
        3D Porous Metal-Organic Framework Exhibiting Selective Adsorption of Water over Organic Solvents
        Gu, Jin-Zhong; Lu, Wen-Guan; Jiang, Long; Zhou, Hong-Cai; Lu, Tong-Bu
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2007), 46 (15), 5835-5837CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        A 3D porous metal-org. framework (MOF) with 1D open channels has been constructed hydrothermally using ZnII and a rigid planar ligand IDC3- (imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylate). This MOF can adsorb water selectively over org. solvents and can be regenerated and reused. It also represents a rare example of a MOF with open channels that form/collapse reversibly upon hydration/dehydration.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXmvV2qs7g%253D&md5=b71b5a514bc0a1fde9c58bf3c7aa9196
        (f) Zhong, R. Q.; Zuo, R. Q.; Xu, Q. Microporous Mesoporous Mater.2007 102 122
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        18f
        Microporous metal-organic framework zinc(II) imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylate: four-fold helical structure and strong fluorescent emission
        Zhong, Rui-Qin; Zou, Ru-Qiang; Xu, Qiang
        Microporous and Mesoporous Materials (2007), 102 (1-3), 122-127CODEN: MIMMFJ; ISSN:1387-1811. (Elsevier B.V.)
        A novel 3-dimensional metal-org. framework of Zn(II) imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylate, [Zn5(L)2(HL)2(DMF)4]n (1) (H3L = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid), was solvothermally synthesized and structurally characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction. This compd. crystallizes in the orthorhombic system with the space group Pbca and a 14.1613(8), b 15.6764(9), c 16.1345(9) and Z = 4. The crystal structure presents a novel 3-dimensional framework with the rare 4-fold helical structure and open channels, exhibiting guest-coordination sites at channel walls and strong fluorescent emission.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXksVyitLc%253D&md5=b16c3ae32731ed443106ed8159c49050
      19. 19
        (a) Panagiotis, A.; Jeff, W. K.; Vincent, L. P. Inorg. Chem.2005 44 3626
        [ACS Full Text ], Google Scholar
        There is no corresponding record for this reference.
        (b) Mahata, P.; Natarajan, S. Eur. J. Inorg. Chem.2005 2156
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        19b
        Pyridine- and imidazoledicarboxylates of zinc: hydrothermal synthesis, structure, and properties
        Mahata, Partha; Natarajan, Srinivasan
        European Journal of Inorganic Chemistry (2005), (11), 2156-2163CODEN: EJICFO; ISSN:1434-1948. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        The reaction of heterocyclic dicarboxylic acids, such as pyridine-2,5-dicarboxylic acid and imidazole-4,5-dicarboxylic acid, under hydrothermal conditions in the presence of an appropriate Zn salt yields three new Zn coordination polymers 0∞[{Zn2(H2O)4}[C5H3N(COO)2]2] (1), 1∞[{Zn(C12H8N2)}{C5H3N(COO)2}·0.5H2O] (2), and 1∞[{Zn(C12H8N2)}[C3HN2(COO)2]] (3). While 1 forms with a zero-dimensional mol. rectangular box structure, 2 and 3 have zigzag 1-dimensional chain structures. The Zn2+ ions are coordinated by both the carboxylate O atoms and also by the nitrogen atoms of the heterocycles. The 1,10-phenanthroline mols. in 2 and 3 act as a secondary ligands and occupy the inter-chain spaces. The moderate H-bond interaction energy in 1 and the π···π interactions in 2 and 3 appear to play an important role for the structural stability. The structures of 2 and 3 appear to be related, even though they are formed with different carboxylic acids. All three compds. exhibit photoluminescence at room temp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXmsV2gurY%253D&md5=5a557af5b9326aa9dcb40f57ec696258
      20. 20
        (a) Zheng, S. L.; Yang, J. H.; Yu, X. L.; Chen, X. M.; Wong, W. T. Inorg. Chem.2004 43 830
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        20a
        Syntheses, Structures, Photoluminescence, and Theoretical Studies of d10 Metal Complexes of 2,2'-Dihydroxy-[1,1']binaphthalenyl-3,3'-dicarboxylate
        Zheng, Shao-Liang; Yang, Jin-Hua; Yu, Xiao-Lan; Chen, Xiao-Ming; Wong, Wing-Tak
        Inorganic Chemistry (2004), 43 (2), 830-838CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        The free solvated ligand, H2bna·MeOH·H2O (1), and its dimeric complex, [Cd2(bna)2(H2O)6] (2) (bna = 2,2'-dihydroxy-[1,1']-binaphthalene-3,3'-dicarboxylate), were obtained by evapn. of the solns., while two new d10 metal-hydroxy cluster-based coordination polymers, [Cd8(OH)4(H2O)10(bna)6]·17H2O (3) and [Hpy]2[Zn4(OH)2(H2O)2(bna)4]·2H2O·2MeCN (4), were obtained by a hydrothermal route. All the compds. were characterized by x-ray crystallog. and photoluminescence measurements. Compd. 1 consists of a three-dimensional, H-bonded supramol. array, 2 exhibits a dimeric mol. featuring a square motif organized by two Cd(II) atoms and two bna ligands each at the corner, and 3 contains unprecedented [Cd8(μ3-OH)2(μ-OH)2(μ-H2O)2]12+ octanuclear metallacrown cores which are interlinked through bna to afford a two-dimensional structure, while 4 features layers with butterfly-shaped [Zn4(μ3-OH)2]6+ clusters. All the complexes display photoluminescent properties in the blue/green range. The manifestation of photoluminescence, as probed by MO calcns. performed on the complexes and also on hypothetical multinuclear complexes, is attributed to a ligand-to-metal charge-transfer mechanism. In addn. to presenting a new approach for the study of the photoluminescent properties of metal-cluster-based coordination polymers by using simple model compds., the study also reveals the dominant role of the structure of the ligand over that of the d10 metal-hydroxy (or oxy) cluster and the presence of the cluster significantly increasing the emission lifetime.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXnt1w%253D&md5=e62d73a4481385bcf409a5682ce12b75
        (b) Dai, J. C.; Wu, X. T.; Fu, Z. Y.; Cui, C. P.; Hu, S. H.; Du, W. X.; Wu, L. M.; Zhang, H. H.; Sun, R. Q. Inorg. Chem.2002 41 1391
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        20b
        Synthesis, Structure, and Fluorescence of the Novel Cadmium(II)-Trimesate Coordination Polymers with Different Coordination Architectures
        Dai, Jing-Cao; Wu, Xin-Tao; Fu, Zhi-Yong; Cui, Chuan-Peng; Hu, Sheng-Min; Du, Wen-Xin; Wu, Li-Ming; Zhang, Han-Hui; Sun, Rui-Qing
        Inorganic Chemistry (2002), 41 (6), 1391-1396CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Three novel complexes, Cd3tma2·13H2O (1), Cd3tma2·dabco·2H2O (2), and Cd3Htma3·8H2O (3) (tma = trimesate, dabco = 1,4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]octane), of Cd(II)-trimesate coordination polymers were obtained from hydrothermal reaction. 1 (C18H32O25Cd3) crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2/c [a = 18.985(2) Å, b 7.3872(6), c 20.432(2) Å, β 97.1660(10)°, and Z = 4]. 2 (C24H22N2O14Cd3) crystallizes in the monoclinic P2(1)/c space group [a = 10.1323(2) Å, b 19.5669(5), c 13.15880(10) Å, β 108.9810(10)°, and Z = 4]. 3 (C27H28O26Cd3) belongs to the trigonal P31c space group [a = 15.7547(3) Å, b 15.7547(3), c 7.93160(10) Å, and Z = 2]. 1 (C18H32O25Cd3) crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2/c [a = 18.985(2), b 7.3872(6), c 20.432(2) Å, β 97.1660(10)°, and Z = 4]; 2 (C24H22N2O14Cd3) crystallizes in the monoclinic P2(1)/c space group [a = 10.1323(2), b 19.5669(5), c 13.15880(10) Å, β 108.9810(10)°, and Z = 4]; 3 (C27H28O26Cd3) belongs to the trigonal P31c space group [a = 15.7547(3), b 15.7547(3), c 7.93160(10) Å, and Z = 2]. The Cd(II) centers in the three complexes are bridged by tma ligands in the coordination fashion of unidentate, bridging unidentate, bidentate, chelating bis-bidentate, chelating/bridging bis-bidentate, or chelating/bridging bidentate to form the T-shaped mol. bilayer motif for 1, chicken-wire-like motif for 2, and honeycomb-like porous structure for 3, resp., in which the T-shaped mol. bilayer motif and chicken-wire-like motif are further interlinked in interdigitating or alternating fashion to construct the different coordination architectures. These three complexes exhibit strong fluorescent emission bands at 355 nm (λex = 220 nm) for 1, 437 nm (λex = 365 nm) for 2, and 353 nm (λex = 218 nm) for 3 in the solid state at room temp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38XhtlCmt7o%253D&md5=247cb068db37f6528a6084d829b82cfe
        (c) Wang, X. L.; Qin, C.; Wang, E. B.; Li, Y. G.; Hao, N.; Hu, C. W.; Xu, L. Inorg. Chem.2004 43 1850
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        20c
        Syntheses, Structures, and Photoluminescence of a Novel Class of d10 Metal Complexes Constructed from Pyridine-3,4-dicarboxylic Acid with Different Coordination Architectures
        Wang, Xinlong; Qin, Chao; Wang, Enbo; Li, Yangguang; Hao, Na; Hu, Changwen; Xu, Lin
        Inorganic Chemistry (2004), 43 (6), 1850-1856CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Two novel d10 metal coordination polymers [Zn(PDB)]n (1) and [Cd3(PDB)2(OH)2(H2O)2]n (2) (H2PDB = pyridine-3,4-dicarboxylic acid) were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and characterized by elemental anal., IR, TGA, and single-crystal x-ray diffraction. Crystal data for 1: C7H3NO4Zn, orthorhombic space group Pna21, a 8.423(17), b 6.574(13), c 12.899(3) Å, Z = 4. Crystal data for 2: C14H12N2O12Cd3, monoclinic space group C2/c, a 20.130(4), b 6.692(13), c 13.081(3) Å, β 102.78(3)°, Z = 4. Both compds. exhibit novel three-dimensional frameworks. Compd. 1 not only possesses a 1-dimensional rectangular channel but also contains infinite double-stranded helical chains. Compd. 2 has two different types of channels, one being built up from pyridine rings and {CdO5N} and {CdO6} building units and the other being constructed from pyridine rings and {CdO5N} building units. Also, both compds. show strong photoluminescence properties at room temp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXht1Gjtbo%253D&md5=22c107e54e4d9869b8adde67c5e842f8
        (d) Su, Y.; Zang, S. Q.; Li, Y. Z.; Zhu, H. F.; Meng, Q. J. Cryst. Growth Des.2007 7 1277
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        20d
        Four d10 Metal Coordination Polymers Containing Isomeric Thiodiphthalic Ligands: Crystal Structures and Luminescent Properties
        Su, Yang; Zang, Shuangquan; Li, Yizhi; Zhu, Huizhen; Meng, Qingjin
        Crystal Growth & Design (2007), 7 (7), 1277-1283CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Two versatile ligands, 2,3,2',3'-tdpa (tdpa = thiodiphthalic acid) and its isomer 2,3,3',4'-tdpa, were introduced to construct novel metal-org. frameworks with interesting structural motifs and good function. By hydrothermal reactions with d10 metals (Zn and Cd), four coordination polymers were obtained and characterized. [Cd2L(bpy)(H2O)3]·H2O (1) is a 3-dimensional framework embodying two distinct types of helical chains. [Zn2L(bpy)(H2O)2]·3H2O (2) features a 2-dimensional lamellar structure with helixes and 14-membered rings in every layer. [Cd2L'(bpy)0.5(H2O)3] (3) is a 3-dimensional framework bearing the (62.83.10)(62.8)(6.8.10) topol. and has chiral layers in it. [Zn(H2L')(bpy)] (4) shows a quasi-2D structure with 1-dimensional binuclear Zn chains and less common monocoordinated 4,4'-bipyridine ligands. All four of these coordination polymers exhibit intense blue fluorescence emissions (1 at 429 nm, 2 at 473 nm, 3 at 451 nm, and 4 at 492 nm) and may be suitable as excellent candidates of blue fluorescent materials.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXlslyntb4%253D&md5=39f2f73575c239f4072c6a24775ff487
      21. 21
        Sheldrick, G. M. SADABS, Program for Empirical Absorption Correction of Area Detector Data; University of Gottingen: Gottingen, Germany, 1996.

        There is no corresponding record for this reference.
      22. 22
        Sheldrick, G. M. SHELXTL-97, Program for Crystal Structure Solution and Refinement; University of Gottingen: Gottingen, Germany, 1997.
